news_header: Sexually transmitted infections (STIs) are on the rise in Europe, with gonorrhea cases reaching a record high of nearly 100,000 in 2023. Rates of syphilis also increased by 13%, while chlamydia remains the most reported STI.
news_original_title: STIs in Europe: Gonorrhea and syphilis hit record highs
news_text: Experts attribute the rise in bacterial STIs to decreased condom use, particularly among young people, and improved testing and reporting practices. The importance of safe sex practices and regular STI testing is emphasized to combat the spread of infections.
